lines.transliteration_english: Binu Ras Rasanaa Bakat Jee Bahout Baatai , Praym Ras Basi Bhaay Moni Brat Leen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without tasting the elixir of Naam, an insipid tongue speaks much trash. On the contrary, by indulging in repeated utterance of His name, a devotee becomes sweet of tongue and pleasant of disposition.

lines.gurmukhi: pRym rs AMmiRq inDwn pwn kY mdon AMqr iDAwn diRg duqIAw n cIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Ras Anmrit Nidhaan Paan Kai Madona , Antar Dhiaan Drig Douteeaa N Cheen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By drinking the elixir-like Naam, a devotee remains in a state of exhilaration. He starts seeing inward and depends not on anyone else.

lines.gurmukhi: pRym nym shj smwiD Anhd ilv duqIAw sbd s√çnMqir n kIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Praym Naym Sahaj Samaadhi Anahad Liva , Douteeaa Sabad Sravanantari N Keen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The devoted traveller on the path of Naam stays in a state of equipoise and remains absorbed in the celestial melody of divine words music. He hears no other sound in his ears.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsm ibdyh jg jIvn mukiq Bey qiRBvn Aau qiRkwl gMimqw pRbIn hY ]65]
lines.transliteration_english: Bisam Bidayh Jag Jeevan Moukati Bhaay , Tribhavan Au Trikaal Ganmitaa Prabeen Hai ?65?

Shabad OS B.translation: And in this blissful state, he is free of body and still alive. He is free from all worldly things and is emancipated while still living. He becomes capable of knowing the happenings of the three worlds and of the three periods. (65)
